summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 regarding travel arrangements and expenses for fact witnesses in the Epstein case. It details airfare costs for multiple individuals traveling from various locations to New York City, with a total airfare cost of approximately $58,000.

events.title: Fact Witness Travel Coordination
events.description: Email coordination for airfare and hotel reservations for multiple individuals traveling to New York City as fact witnesses in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was arranging and paying for fact witness travel in the Epstein case in August 2019.
Total airfare cost for the travel arrangements was approximately $58,000 for multiple individuals.
Travel was arranged from at least eight different locations, including international travel from Barcelona, Spain, to New York City.
The email indicates a high level of logistical coordination and significant government expenditure for witness travel shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019.
